1.text: Be ye therefore imitators of God, as dearly beloved children;

2.text: And walk ye in love, as also Christ loved us, and gave himself for us a gift and sacrifice to God for a smell of sweet odor.

3.text: And fornication, and all uncleanness, or overreaching, let it not be named with you, as becomes the holy;

4.text: And obscenity, and silly discourse, or wit, which things concern not; but rather thankfulness.

5.text: For this ye are knowing, that every fornicator, or unclean, or covetous person, who is an idolater, has no inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

6.text: Let none lead you astray with vain words: for by these things comes the anger of God upon the sons of disobedience.

7.text: Be ye not therefore partakers with them.

8.text: For ye were then darkness, and now light in the Lord: walk ye as children of light:

9.text: (For the fruit of the Spirit in all goodness and justice and truth;)

10.text: Trying what is pleasing to the Lord.

11.text: And participate not with the unfruitful works of darkness, and rather also confute.

12.text: For the things done secretly by them it is also shameful to speak.

13.text: And all things refuted, by light are made manifest: for everything made manifest is light.

14.text: Wherefore he says, Awake, who sleeping, and arise from the dead, and Christ will enlighten thee.

15.text: See therefore how ye walk accurately, not as unwise, but as wise,

16.text: Making purchase of time, for the days are evil.

17.text: For this be not foolish, but understanding what the will of the Lord.

18.text: And be not drunk with wine, in which is debauchery; but be filled with the Spirit;

19.text: Speaking to yourselves on harps, and songs, and spiritual odes, singing and playing on the harp in your heart to the Lord;

20.text: Giving thanks always for all things, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to God and the Father;

21.text: Yielding obedience to one another in the fear of God.

22.text: Women, yield ye obedience to your own husbands, as to the Lord.

23.text: For the husband is the head of the wife, as also Christ the head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body.

24.text: But as the church is subjected to Christ, so also wives to their own husbands in everything.

25.text: Husbands, love your own wives, as also Christ loved the church, and delivered himself up for it;

26.text: That he might consecrate it, having cleansed by the washing of water in the word,

27.text: That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing: but that it be holy and blameless.

28.text: So ought men to love their own wives as their own bodies. He loving his wife, loves himself.

29.text: For none at any time hates his own flesh; but brings it up and cherishes it, as also the Lord the church:

30.text: For we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.

31.text: For this a man shall leave his father and mother, and be joined to his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.

32.text: This is a great mystery: but I speak to Christ and to the church.

33.text: But ye also altogether, let each so love his own wife as himself: and the wife that she fear her husband.
